messages.message: Hey, i’ll put my feedback of the new AI Hub preview here.

I seem to be getting worse results for some questions compared to when using the `ailabs-gtm` instance.

The one from the old instance is correct, the one from the new preview is less accurate, almost like its taken a summary rather than looked for the actual type.
My avatar placeholder is always a ‘1’ - not sure where that came from.
Avatar placeholder is due to Okta integration - we will fix to reflect proper user names! :slightly_smiling_face:

I’ve uploaded a 5 page document and asked it what the doc type is, underneath it tells me where its retrieved the result from and shows provenance.

• This list is quite long and takes up a lot of space.
• I think it would make more sense to collapse it behind an icon, so I can view that if I choose to but default to closed. 
• Its highlighting most of the page regardless of what question I ask. 
• I’ve only uploaded one document, so showing me the filename isn’t that helpful. If i’ve only got one doc, I think showing the page number would make more sense.
See the whole page prov tracking here, even though the value is right at the top.
I can switch between `active document` and `all documents` even if i’ve only uploaded a single doc

This thing slides out over the top of the document, which means the ‘add documents’ button is hidden until I click that. It’s not obvious to me thats where the button is without clicking around.

I think the button is in the right place, its just not discoverable as the slide out is only temporary.

I think it’d prefer it to shift the UI over when open - rather than overlay, and stay there unless i close it.

Also in that slide out thing ^ it would be nice if we showed a thumbnail of the first page of the document rather than just the filename. I use visual cues a lot more when moving about than I do remembering filenames.
I like these things. Maybe when the doc list drawer isn’t open, the + one could be overlayed over the top of the doc view at the bottom so that I know how to get more docs in there
I like these things. Maybe when the doc list drawer isn’t open, the + one could be overlayed over the top of the doc view at the bottom so that I know how to get more docs in there

I *MUCH* prefer the new design language we are using vs traditional pollen. The purple accents are much more on brand, and overall it looks a lot more professional (with much nicer padding and spacing).

I also like the dark view around the document.

It really makes the toast and modal components look out of place though, would be nice to see these be updated to ‘new Pollen’(?)

One thing I keep automatically trying to do is press the up key on my keyboard to put the last typed message back in the chat box. A bit like you do in slack to edit the last message, or in terminal to get the previous command back.

It would be good if we did this here, often i’ll ask a question and want to modify it, rather than typing again it would be good if up brought back my last message back in the box to send again. I think the terminal approach vs slack would work better here.
This element keeps expanding, rather than setting the overflow to ellipsis
The same for the document names.
The page isn’t responsive which for prosumer, I think is important
Thanks so much for your feedback, @Lee - incredibly useful. I’ll come back with follow up Qs in case of clarification.
